storyInfo: Regaining the light of day after a brief spell of blindness.

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Landship
Astesia's Room
(Rubs eyes)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: If I recall correctly...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: According to the books, the constellations should be stable and distinct tonight.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Hopefully it'll be a fruitful... night...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Rubs eyes subconsciously)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: My recent calculations have deviated greatly from the data published by the Astrology Society.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Father must be displeased...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I should wait a while before sending my response to him.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Oripathy... Oripathy...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Rubs eyes subconsciously)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I'll make a few more notes tonight. If the projections are still off, we'll need to get the right data from observation.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Lightly rubs eyes)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: *Yawn*...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: My eyes itch...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Hey Sia, I'm here.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Mm. Good mor—
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: What's going on with your eyes?!
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: My eyes? They're just a little itchy.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: They're completely bloodshot!
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: They'll get better soon...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: There are even lumps...
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: This isn't something that recovers on its own.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I'll take you to Medical.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: But tonight—
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Forget about the stars. The stars won't heal your eyes.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Come with me.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: W-Wait...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Bacterial infection. Acute inflammation in both eyes with pus formation.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Perfectly treatable. Just a minor surgery and some medication, and you'll be good as new in a couple of days.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: But you won't be able to see for 36 hours. You should arrange to stay the night here.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Can we delay the surgery?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I'll make the call, doctor.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Well, the two of you can work it out amongst yourselves.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Genne...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: The answer is no.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I know why you wanted to put it off, and I know how much this means to you.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: But let me say it again.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: The answer is no.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: You know what I care about more than anything.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: She's agreed to the surgery.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I need to hear it from you directly, Operator Astesia.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Hushed) Yeah...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Then I'll need the signature of a family member for this informed consent form.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Reads and signs the form)
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: (Takes the form and enters data into a terminal)
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Go reserve a bed at the front desk. You'll be taken to the ward directly after surgery. Family members can wait there.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Follow me, Operator Astesia.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Relax. It's a simple operation.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: As we told you earlier, you'll be under general anesthesia for the surgery. Is that okay?
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Nods)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Administers anesthetic)
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Count from one to ten.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: One.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Two.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: After an indeterminate period of time...
Can you speak?
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Move your finger if you hear me.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Slight finger wag)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: The patient is awake.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: The operation went well. The nurses will take you to your ward in a bit, and I'll stop by on my nightly rounds.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Let me know if you feel any discomfort.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Nod if you hear me.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Nods with effort)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: The doctor's footsteps fade away. The bed is laid flat and pushed into the corridor.
The wheels make a screeching sound as they touch the ground.
Even noisier, however, are the complaints of doctors, patients, and accompanying personnel.
Just be patient, Popukar. It'll be your turn soon.
Why are there so many sick people today? Who's next?!
I already paid! What's—I have to sign an agreement? Fine, fine, bring it on, my sister's waiting for me on her bed.
How was I supposed to know I'd be allergic to this nail polish? Ow... it itches...
Voices come from all directions, carrying emotions that not even the speakers are aware of.
Sadness, regret, fear; Astesia hears all of it.
She feels uneasy.
Normally, she would be the one to comfort these people in distress.
Right now, however, she is the one lying on a hospital bed.
The bed stops in the corridor, turns, and enters a ward.
Medics secure the bed and give the usual inpatient briefing.
Once satisfied that their patient is doing fine, they leave briskly.
The voices from the Medical Department leave Astesia's head as soon as the door closes.
It is silent.
Genne...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: As the effects of the anesthetic wear off, she begins calling for her younger sister.
Genne... are you there?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: No one responds.
Anyone?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: There is nothing here but her own voice.
She feels a sense of helplessness.
She used to be an astrologer guiding the paths of many.
Right now, however, she can neither reveal the path for someone else, nor see that of her own.
Ever since the Originium took root in her body...
The stars are silent.
She remembers that some of the most famous astromancers never tried to hide the fact that they were Infected.
She remembers the look on her father's face when he learned of her infection.
Concern, mingled with joy.
Which is why he could not hide his disappointment when he learned that infection had not made his daughter a great astromancer; far from it, in fact.
Perhaps the stars forsook her for her cowardice, as she cowered in the safehouse while her sister faced the lab's Originium leak on her own.
The stars rescinded their mercy, leaving behind only the cold glint of Originium.
So shiny, it pierces the heart.
(Whispers) Sia...
(Whispers) Are you alright?
...Genne?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm here.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: It was such a pain trying to get a quiet single room for you.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: A single room... you're wasting money again.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Not really, I just diverted a bit of equipment funding.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: What's the matter? Your palms are sweaty.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: No... I'm fine...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Do your eyes feel any better?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: They don't itch anymore. Dr. Folinic did a great job.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: And to think you're the one who was always telling me to go to bed and get up early.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Still thinking about stargazing tonight?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: The conditions are the best they've been for months.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I'll tell the doctor to tie you to the bed if you so much as try to take those bandages off.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I won't. I'm just thinking about it.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: My eyes are more important. I'll listen to you.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Hm... alright, fine then.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Not that Dad would appreciate the results anyway.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: How did you—
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I looked at your observation logs and conclusions. They're very different from the Society's.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I caught a glimpse while looking for your ID.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: You left them on the desk.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Ever since then, not once have I been able to provide Father and the Society with the right data. Of course he would be angry with me...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Actually, I made some calculations based on that data of yours.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: You were right. Always were.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: You don't need to comfort me.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I know what I'm doing. I never liked stargazing, but I DID have a formal education in it forced down my throat.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: What's right is right, and what's wrong is wrong. I don't need to lie to you.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I can present the steps and possibility spaces in data models for you, if you like. After your eyes have healed.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Are you suggesting that the Society's data is wrong?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Yeesh, did you really have to inherit Dad's hard head too?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Have you ever considered that you could both be correct?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: It's not exactly unusual in science.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Data can be affected by external factors. Rhodes Island isn't in Columbia. The observation environment and geographic location are completely different.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: The stars don't move in regular ways, either. Frankly, I'd be more shocked if your results were exactly the same.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: But the algorithm has already been adjusted for position!
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Take it easy, Sia.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: That's why I said your data is right.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I picked up Dad's methods faster than you, but your results were always way more accurate.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: It's high time you accepted that he's not always right. Don't just assume that you're wrong because they doubt you.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: (Whisper) Not that I'm in a position to lecture anyone...
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Ahem. Anyway, I'll help you out with it once you get better. We could even go home and confront Dad together, if we have to. How's that?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Let me hold your hand, Genne.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Oh, come on, how old are you? Here.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: (Holds her sister's hand gently)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: No need for that between sisters.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Don't overthink it. Just get some rest and heal up.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Anything you want to eat?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Drizzle cake—
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Nut cookies and berry juice. Got it.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I'll make dinner. You've been the cook ever since I got here. You should try my cooking once in a while.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I'll get to it, then.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: (Gently moves her sister's hand)
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I left some cut fruit on the table to your left. There's a toothpick in each piece. Just put them back on the plate when you're done.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: And here—
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Your astrolabe's to the right of your pillow.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: That should be all.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I'll be going, then. Take care.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: The door closes again, leaving Astesia by herself once more.
The world is still dark, but the darkness does not feel so oppressive this time, with the astrolabe's gentle clockwork humming by her side.
Her sister's encouragement has helped her reassess her situation.
Is she independent?
No, not compared to Astgenne.
Her sister continues to break new ground, striving for the lifestyle she wants. Meanwhile, she herself lacks the courage to even rebut her father's doubts.
Astrology is a school of tradition. It is not as systematic as modern science, but it is old, and with age comes authority.
She realized at an early age that her explorations and questions would be shot down by her teachers, or given an established answer. And she would accept it, even if she did not agree.
No mistakes were made, therefore they must be right.
She is afraid of being denied by authority, and so she accepts their conclusions without question.
Then why did Oripathy break that barrier?
Is it because she encountered the dilemma of either denying authority or denying self?
Or did her sister's courage inspire her to face her longtime doubts?
Astesia does not yet have the answer.
Other than preparing meals, Astgenne spends the rest of the day by Astesia's side, making life stuck in a hospital bed more bearable.
Astgenne wanted to stay by her sister's side as night fell too, but Astesia persuaded her to return to her own quarters.
She knows that bright stars fill the sky above Rhodes Island as it travels.
She has seen that sight countless times, but continues to be fascinated by the uncertainty that lies within. She would gaze upon it forever, if she could, but right now—
Was there something else, Genne?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: It's me. I'm making my rounds.
Oh, my apologies, Dr. Folinic.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: How are your eyes feeling? Any itching, excessive tearing, or the sensation of heat or foreign objects?
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: No. The surgery went well.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Then you should recover soon.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: You sound awfully tired.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I'm used to it. It's like this every day.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Feel free to have a seat then, if you're not busy.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: My sister cut me so much fruit that I can hardly finish all of it.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: It's almost time for lights-out. You're the last patient tonight.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: I think I can stay... fifteen minutes.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Thank you, Doctor. There should be a chair by my bed.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Astgenne has a knack for picking fruits.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: We've both always liked these.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Actually, I have something I wanted to ask, but I was afraid it might be offensive.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I don't meet many operators who work with divination or the occult.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: In my eyes, people like that seem like they're trying to pass themselves off as omniscient and omnipotent.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: If you can really tell the future, why weren't you even able to avoid your own illness?
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: I've never once considered myself omniscient.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: It's just that I was born to a family of astrologers, so that's what I've studied since I was little.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: You may find this sort of knowledge to be abstract and impractical, but if I want to help people, it's all I have.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: From the Columbian elites to the uneducated young men in the Pioneer teams, many encounter things that their own knowledge and experiences cannot explain.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: In such cases, they try to dispel their doubts through the supernatural. That's what I understand to be the reason for studying these matters.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: There are times when you have doubts yourself, aren't there, Dr. Folinic?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: ...You wouldn't understand.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Did you know that the brightest constellation in the sky tonight is the symbol of Ursus?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I don't know what pains you harbor, but I can surmise the reasons through unscientific means.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Not that I could comfort you, though. To you, it would seem nothing but meaningless derision.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Ha...
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: You would make a great psychiatrist, Astesia.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: I'll take that as a compliment.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Even the best psychiatrist can't foretell an eye infection, after all.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Instead, it must be treated by someone with concrete knowledge, like you.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: It's about time for me to head out.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: Rest well, Astesia. You should be able to see the light again by this time tomorrow.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: The doctor turns off the lights before she leaves. Astesia falls asleep, dreaming of the starry sky.
She has loved the stars from a young age, just as her sister loved science.
For her, watching the skies is a habit born of both nature and nurture.
Which is why it hurt so much to be rejected and denied.
Not because she was rejected by authority, but because of the regret that she did not understand.
The more she studies this abstract wisdom, the smaller she feels.
Does the answer truly lie in the stars?
Astesia does not know the answer.
But there is one thing she knows.
A traveler who loses his way in the night gazes up towards the stars, his eternal companion, before continuing on his journey until he finds his way again.
Astesia wakes from her dream as the sun shines in, visible through her bandages and eyelids.
She is waiting for her sister.
With her help, she could at least get her teeth brushed, wipe the parts of her face not covered by bandages, and move around a little before lying down again.
She hears the long-awaited sound of the door.
But it is not Astgenne.
Are you ok, Astesia?!
Tomimi? What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I came with Gavial. She told me that one of my friends got admitted yesterday, so I ran over right away.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Are you okay? That looks serious. Did you get hit in the eyes?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: No, it was just an infection. It'll heal soon.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: By the way, could you tell me if there are toiletries by the bed? Toothbrush, towels, that sort of thing?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Yup.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: (Gets up from the bed)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Then could you grab them for me and lead me to the bathroom?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Sure thing!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Take it nice and slow...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Here we are.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Toothbrush, toothpaste, and cup. Need me to squeeze the toothpaste for you too?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I can do that much myself. The towel, too.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Alrighty then.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: (Squeezes out the toothpaste and begins brushing)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I just set up a couple of pedestals in my room so I could put stuff on them, but Gavial's eyes lit up when she saw them. She said they were really cool, like totems.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: (Mumbles)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Oh, and I took my nursing test a while back.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I don't like tests, but now that I passed it, I can help Gavial with her medical work.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: (Nods while brushing)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: And Bibeak started teaching me how to make clothes. Soon I'll be able to make beautiful clothes for everyone!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Why are you so quiet, Astesia?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: (Rinses mouth)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Don't worry, I was listening.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Washes towel)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: You're doing wonderfully, Tomimi.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Hehe, it's all thanks to your tips. I've been really thinking about what I want to do and what I can do.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: What you want to do and what you can do... hmm.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Wipes face gently)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: But all that good stuff has got me in trouble now.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Wrings the towel to dry it)
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Would you mind helping me back to the bed? We can talk more once we're seated.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Oh, sure.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Careful.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Watch your feet...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Here we are.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Have a seat.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I'm sitting.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: So, what sort of troubles are you having then?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Now I have to think about caring for my babies, helping out Gavial, making clothes with Bibeak, and everything else.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I just feel like I don't have time...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Are you... considering giving up on something?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Yeah. Maybe there's just too much stuff I wanna do, and there are also tons of things I have to do here at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Maybe the fun stuff will have to wait...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: And that upsets you.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Yeah, Astesia! Exactly!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: But I'm not sure how I can balance everything...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: It's human nature to want to have your cake and eat it too. Once missed, some opportunities will never return. You shouldn't be too hard on yourself over it.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Mmhmm.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Perhaps you're unaware, but time management is an entire field of its own.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: I can't say I'm an expert in it myself, but I'll teach you what I know.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Alright! Thank you so much!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Is this part of astrology too?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Astrology? No.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: The stars may show us the path, but they can't walk it for us.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: That requires self-determination, and no end of effort.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: But I think you can handle it. Can't you?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Uh... Yeah!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Will you be visiting the bookstore tomorrow afternoon?
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Uh-huh.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Then do wait for me there. We can talk once you've bought the magazine.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Okay!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: You should be going now; no doubt Gavial's been griping about where her aide went off to.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: You think? Okay, later!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Thanks, Astesia!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: You're welcome.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Huh... was that a friend?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Have you washed your face yet?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Mhm!
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Even though you can't see?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: I had someone to be my eyes for me.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: Figures. It's only been a day, and there's already a line outside your door.
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: Well then, what do you want to eat today?
attributes.name: Astgenne

attributes.content: The sun has set, and after a long day Astgenne falls asleep by her sister's side.
Astesia enjoys the peace of the darkness as she awaits the light.
Ast—
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Whispers) How are your eyes, Astesia?
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Whispers) Feeling wonderful, thanks to you.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Whispers) Then I'll be taking the bandages off now.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: The doctor cuts away Astesia's blindfolds.
Then she wipes off the remaining ointment with a cotton swab.
(Whispers) Congratulations on making a full recovery, Operator Astesia.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Whispers) I've dimmed the lights. You can turn them up again once your eyes adjust.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Whispers) Refrain from drinking, spicy foods, and strenuous activity.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Whispers) I've also prescribed you some eye drops. Your sister has the prescription.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Whispers) I appreciate it.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Whispers) ...I'd also like to have a chat with you this weekend, if you have some free time.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Whispers) I think I could use a shrink.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: (Whispers) Anytime. Have a pleasant evening, Dr. Folinic.
attributes.name: Astesia

attributes.content: (Whispers) You too.
attributes.name: Folinic

attributes.content: The doctor leaves. Astesia slowly opens her eyes, and sees her sister sleeping by the bed, alongside her own notebooks on the stars.
She opens them. The writing on the last few pages resembles her own, but not quite. Astgenne had made detailed notes on the stars last night.
There were some mistakes in the markings, and some misspelled stars.
But what does it matter?
Astesia closes her eyes and gazes towards the night sky beyond the window.
There are no stars there. Even the moon has been obscured by the dark clouds, with not a single ray shining through.
But there are stars. There, in her own eyes.
They shimmer and shine.
